outputs.output_descr:
Strengthened systems and capacities for sustainable conflict prevention and management.
Increased conflict sensitive recovery, reconciliatory practices and reintegration at community level (with a focus on women and children) through basic service delivery and development of economic opportunities.

UNDP launched the one-year Conflict Reduction Programme (CRP) inception phase in one of the three areas - Southern Kordofan State - in October 2009, with the objective to pilot a new approach towards the prevention and resolution of local conflict; in particular, around flashpoints and issues with the potential to escalate and threaten the stability of the Comprehensive Peace Agreement . During the one year inception phase, CRP successfully established collaborative relationships with key partners and stakeholders engaged in peace building and recovery in the state and leveraged these to provide timely, effective support in capacity building, conflict resolution initiatives and peace dividend to its primary implementing partner, the Reconciliation and Peaceful Co-existence Mechanism (RPCM). Notably, all peace agreements achieved with CRP support continue to hold.  UNDP approached the inception phase as a pilot and contributed meaningfully to peace building efforts in the state simultaneous to refining its implementation modalities and capturing lessons learned for scaled-up application in all the Three Protocol Areas over the coming two-year period

Output 2.3 Improved community confidence in local rule of law institutions  in Southern Sudan
Output 2.3.1 Strengthened capacity of rule of law institutions in Southern Sudan through increased awareness of human rights especially gender issues
Output 2.3.2 Conflict affected communities empowered through increased knowledge of human and legal rights and strengthened traditional conflict resolution mechanisms

project_descr: Reduction of Natural Resource-Based Conflict among Pastoralists and Farmers
